transcripts.text: Do you believe a society should practice complete and universal tolerance?
Well, what do you make of the tolerance paradox?

This was raised by Karl Popper.  He argued that a true tolerant society would in fact end up tolerating the intolerant.  Popper claimed that unlimited tolerance must lead to the disappearance of tolerance.  if we extend unlimited tolerance even to those who are intolerant if we are not prepared to defend a tolerant society against the onslaught of the intolerant then the tolerance will be destroyed and tolerance with them.
so then does toleration in fact need intolerance to survive?
well yes i would agree even though this seems like a contradiction.  it seems true.  toleration needs to be intolerant of the intolerant.
okay good.  so this leads me to the question where should we draw the line between what is tolerable and what is submissive and bordering on being taken advantage of?
